system to mr representative this is notice that a charge of employment discrimination has been filed with eeoc against your organization by m under title vii of civil rights act title vii and age discrimination in employment act adea circumstances of alleged discrimination are based on color age and sex and involve issues of hiring that are alleged to have occurred on or about apr digital charge system makes investigations and communications with charging parties and respondents efficient by digitizing charge documents charge is available for to download from eeoc respondent portal eeoc s secure online system please follow these instructions to view charge within ten days of receiving this notice access eeoc s secure online system https nxg eeoc gov rsp login jsf enter this eeoc charge no enter this temporary password yz kj once log into system can view and download charge and electronically submit documents to eeoc system also advise of possible actions or responses and identify your eeoc point of contact for this charge if are unable to log into eeoc respondent portal or have questions regarding digital charge system can send an email to preservation of records requirement eeoc regulations require respondents to preserve all payroll and personnel records relevant to charge until final disposition of charge or litigation cfr for information on your obligation to preserve records http eeoc gov employers recordkeeping cfm non retaliation requirements enforced by eeoc prohibit retaliation against individual because s he has filed a charge testified assisted or participated in an investigation proceeding or hearing under these filing charges of discrimination are advised of these non retaliation requirements and are instructed to notify eeoc if attempt at retaliation is made for information http www eeoc gov types facts retal cfm representation although do not have to be represented by an attorney while we handle this charge have a right and wish to retain an attorney to represent if do retain an attorney please provide attorney s contact information when log in to online system please retain this notice for your records u s equal employment opportunity commission federal investigation request for position statement and supporting documentary evidence eeoc hereby requests that your organization submit within days a position statement setting all facts which pertain to allegations in charge of discrimination under investigation as well as other facts which relevant for eeoc s consideration we recommend review eeoc s resource guide on effective position statements as prepare your response to this request fact based position statement this is your opportunity to raise and all defenses or factual in response to each of allegations of charge position statement should set all of facts relevant to respond to allegations in charge as well as other facts respondent deems pertinent to eeoc s consideration position statement should only to but not identify information that respondent asserts is sensitive medical information or confidential commercial or financial information eeoc also requests that submit all documentary evidence believe is responsive to allegations of charge if submit only an advocacy statement unsupported by documentary evidence eeoc conclude that respondent has no evidence to support its defense to allegations of charge eeoc release your position statement and non confidential attachments to charging party and her representative and allow them to respond to enable eeoc to assess credibility of information provided by both parties it is in respondent s interest to provide an effective position statement that focuses on facts eeoc not release charging party s response if to respondent if no response is received to this request eeoc proceed directly to a determination on merits of charge based on information at its disposal signed by an authorized representative position statement should be signed by an officer agent or representative of respondent authorized to speak officially on its behalf in this federal investigation segregate confidential information into separately designated attachments if rely on confidential medical or commercial information in position statement should provide information in separate attachments to position statement labeled sensitive medical information confidential commercial or financial information or trade secret information as applicable provide an explanation justifying confidential nature of information contained in attachments medical information about charging party is not sensitive or confidential medical information in relation to eeoc s investigation segregate following information into separate attachments and designate them as follows sensitive medical information except for charging party s medical information social security numbers confidential commercial or financial information trade secrets information non relevant personally identifiable information of witnesses comparators or third parties for example social security numbers dates of birth in non age cases home addresses personal phone numbers and email addresses etc reference to charges filed against respondent by other charging parties requests for an extension if respondent believes it requires additional time to respond it must at earliest possible time in advance of date make a written request for extension explain why an extension is necessary and specify amount of additional time needed to reply submitting a written request for extension of time does not automatically extend deadline for providing position statement upload position statement and attachments into respondent portal can upload your position statement and attachments into respondent portal using upload documents select position statement document type and save upload to send position statement and attachments to eeoc once position statement has been submitted not be able to retract it via portal business manager equal employment opportunity commission eeoc is federal agency with primary responsibility for enforcing our s equal employment opportunity eeo we enforce prohibit discrimination based on color religion sex including on basis of pregnancy gender identity or sexual orientation national origin age disability retaliation and genetic information attached fact sheet provides an overview of eeoc s procedures from time a charge of employment discrimination is filed to point that it is resolved we encourage to visit our online business resource center which provides a wealth of information designed to help businesses we tips and videos on employment topics including to do when receive a charge of discrimination in cases as our first step in processing a charge we mediation as a neutral voluntary and confidential to achieve a mutually satisfactory resolution for all parties seventy five percent of charges that are mediated are successfully resolved in an independent study of employers who tried eeoc s mediation program they would use it again if need arose in addition to eeoc representative identified on notice of charge of discrimination each of our district offices has a business liaison to provide technical assistance and help employers resolve questions about we enforce our mediation program and charge process can find names and contact information of our business liaisons on our web site we encourage to contact business liaison in your area to answer questions have and assure that inquiry or request for information not adversely affect investigation of charge that has been filed yours truly u s equal employment opportunity commission find answers at eeoc s business
